titles.title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for the reissuance of Social Security account numbers to young children in cases where confidentiality has been compromised.
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2018
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2018
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2018
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2018
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2017
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2017
Social Security Child Protection Act of 2018

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 115-635.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 486.

action.text: Mr. Marchant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1512.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: Social Security Child Protection Act of 2018 (Sec. 2) This bill directs the Social Security Administration (SSA) to issue a new Social Security number to a child under the age of 14 if the confidentiality of the child's previous number has, in the course of the SSA's transmission to the child of a Social Security card, been compromised due to the theft of that card.
